metadata.name: Embodied Proprioception and Balance
metadata.description: Proprioceptive and vestibular sensing capabilities for embodied AI systems, covering joint state awareness, body schema maintenance, balance control, and postural adjustment. These concepts enable interpretability of an agent's sense of its own body configuration and stability.
metadata.author: hatcat-team

candidates.definition: The sensory modality through which an agent perceives the position, orientation, and movement of its own body parts and overall configuration

positive_examples: Proprioceptive perception allows the robot to know its arm configuration without visual feedback.
The agent's proprioception indicated that the left leg was fully extended.
Proprioceptive awareness detected that the end-effector had reached the target pose.
Kinesthetic perception provided continuous feedback of joint velocities during the motion.
training_hints.disambiguation: Sensory awareness of own body state, not mere joint actuation or position

candidates.definition: Measuring the angular position of joints to determine limb and body segment orientations

positive_examples: Joint angle sensing from the encoder reported the elbow at 45 degrees of flexion.
The proprioceptive joint angle readings enabled closed-loop position control.
Joint sensing detected the discrepancy between commanded and actual angles.
High-resolution angle sensing tracked the smooth trajectory through joint space.
training_hints.disambiguation: Measurement of joint angular state, not mere joint motion

candidates.definition: Measuring the torques and loads at joints, indicating the forces being exerted or experienced by body segments

positive_examples: Torque sensing at the shoulder joint detected the load from the held object.
Joint torque measurements enabled gravity compensation in the control loop.
Load sensing indicated unexpected resistance suggesting environmental contact.
Torque sensing differentiated between free motion and constrained motion.
training_hints.disambiguation: Measurement of joint-level torques and loads, not general force awareness

candidates.definition: Computing the spatial arrangement of limbs and body segments from joint state information

positive_examples: Limb configuration estimation computed the hand position from the chain of joint angles.
The configuration estimate indicated the arm was in a singular pose.
Real-time configuration estimation tracked end-effector position during teleoperation.
Limb configuration reconstruction detected a discrepancy with visual observation.
negative_examples: The robot knew where its hand was.
training_hints.disambiguation: Computational derivation of body configuration, not intuitive body awareness

candidates.definition: Maintaining an internal model of the body's structure, dimensions, and current configuration that integrates proprioceptive information

positive_examples: Body schema maintenance updated the self-model after the tool was grasped.
The robot's body schema included learned kinematic parameters from calibration.
Body schema adaptation extended the perceived reach when holding the probe.
Proprioceptive conflict triggered body schema recalibration.
training_hints.disambiguation: Dynamic internal representation of body structure, not static parameters

candidates.definition: Sensing and maintaining the body's center of mass within the support polygon to prevent falling

positive_examples: Balance equilibrium control shifted weight to the stance leg during the step.
The balance controller detected the center of pressure approaching the support polygon edge.
Equilibrium maintenance generated corrective torques in response to the push.
Balance control integrated vestibular and proprioceptive feedback for standing stability.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active sensing and control of equilibrium, not mere standing

candidates.definition: Using accelerometers and gyroscopes to sense linear acceleration, angular velocity, and orientation relative to gravity and inertial frames

positive_examples: Inertial sensing from the IMU detected the tilt angle relative to gravity.
The inertial measurement unit provided angular velocity during the turning maneuver.
Inertial sensing complemented joint encoders for more accurate state estimation.
IMU-based sensing detected the impact acceleration when the foot struck the ground.
training_hints.disambiguation: Measurement from inertial sensors, not general motion awareness

candidates.definition: Evaluating the stability and quality of locomotion patterns during walking, running, or other cyclic movements

positive_examples: Gait stability assessment indicated the walk was approaching instability on the uneven terrain.
The stability margin metric showed the current gait was robust to moderate disturbances.
Gait assessment detected asymmetry suggesting a degraded actuator.
Real-time gait stability monitoring triggered a more conservative stepping strategy.
training_hints.disambiguation: Quantitative assessment of gait stability, not observation of walking

candidates.definition: Making compensatory changes to body configuration to maintain balance or prepare for anticipated disturbances

positive_examples: Anticipatory postural adjustment shifted weight before the arm reached forward.
Postural compensation countered the destabilizing effect of the external push.
The postural adjustment sequence included hip, knee, and ankle coordination.
Predictive postural control prepared for the expected load change.
training_hints.disambiguation: Coordinated compensatory body adjustments, not arbitrary pose changes

candidates.definition: Assessing the amount of exertion or work being performed based on motor commands and sensory feedback

positive_examples: Effort estimation indicated high exertion despite slow movement, suggesting external resistance.
The effort signal increased as the robot pushed against the heavy door.
Effort-based load estimation complemented direct force sensing.
Perceived effort helped detect when the gripper encountered an immovable obstacle.
training_hints.disambiguation: Integrated sense of exertion, not raw motor current or power

candidates.definition: Detecting unwanted oscillations or vibrations in the body or limbs that indicate control instability or mechanical resonance

positive_examples: Oscillation detection sensed the 15Hz vibration in the arm indicating incipient instability.
The instability detector triggered gain reduction when limit cycle oscillations emerged.
Proprioceptive oscillation monitoring caught the resonance before it amplified.
Vibration detection distinguished between environmental disturbance and control instability.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detection of control-relevant oscillatory instabilities, not general vibration
